Articles.Content:
It seems like the Big-S wing segments don't produce lift according to the editor. I'll look in gamedata.

File says it makes lift... Huh. Well, I will use them like that. Annoying that it doesn't look like it in the editor. Picture shows the oddity.

![XdhLUtD.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/XdhLUtD.jpg)

[@Mekan1k](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/48750-mekan1k/): Do you have <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> installed? The BigS wing pieces have a <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> configuration <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch that disables the stock ModuleLiftingSurface because <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> doesn't use it

> 
> 
> 35 minutes ago, SuicidalInsanity said:
> 
> 
> [@Mekan1k](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/48750-mekan1k/): Do you have <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> installed? The BigS wing pieces have a <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> configuration <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch that disables the stock ModuleLiftingSurface because <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> doesn't use it
> 

I do not.  I will see if I can remove that file.

> 
> 
> 35 minutes ago, SuicidalInsanity said:
> 
> 
> [@Mekan1k](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/48750-mekan1k/): Do you have <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> installed? The BigS wing pieces have a <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> configuration <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch that disables the stock ModuleLiftingSurface because <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> doesn't use it
> 

I do not.  I will see if I can remove that file.

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, SuicidalInsanity said:
> 
> 
> [@Mekan1k](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/48750-mekan1k/): Do you have <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> installed? The BigS wing pieces have a <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> configuration <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch that disables the stock ModuleLiftingSurface because <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> doesn't use it
> 

shouldn't that <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> config have a :NEEDS[FerramAerospaceResearch] so that people without <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> don't have to remove the <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> config?

It does have a :NEEDS[FerramAerospaceResearch] tag. But from the screenshot it seemed probable that <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> was installed, which is why I brought up the <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch.

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, SuicidalInsanity said:
> 
> 
> But from the screenshot it seemed probable that <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> was installed
> 

if <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> was installed the blue center of lift arrow would not be showing (unless <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> was installed improperly). If <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> isn't installed and the <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch has a :NEEDS, then it shouldn't have any affect on the game. Right? I honestly may not be understanding something here
any chance of making a MK3 Ram intake. you know... for stupidly large aircraft?

@Drew Kerman: At least a version or two back, <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> would still show a lift arrow if a part had a ModuleLiftingSurface, which usually indicated a mod that lacked <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> configs; since the lift arrow was centered on a mod cockpit, I thought it possible that was the case; but yes, the <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch shouldn't have any effect without <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr>.

@Rushligh: I have a few ideas for one, so a ram intake is probably going to happen at some point.
hey SuicidalInsanity how are you, Hows the updates going? Don't know if this has been asked or not [lazy lol]  but does M2X and M3X work on 1.2 pre.

@xD-FireStriker: The current M2X/M3X version have partial functionality in the prerelease; things that are standard parts or use stock modules work fine, anything that uses mesh switching or uses <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> for functionality will be broken and/or non-functional. The KSP 1.2 updates for M2X/M3X will happen after 1.2 is released.
![96hfKmD.png](http://i.imgur.com/96hfKmD.png)

> 
>

> 
> 
> [![96hfKmD.png](http://i.imgur.com/96hfKmD.png)](http://i.imgur.com/96hfKmD.png "Enlarge image")
> 

Mk 3 science lab confirmed?
Mk3 science lab confirmed.

> 
> Mk3 science lab confirmed.

That sounds awsome, and with [@SuicidalInsanity](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/143878-suicidalinsanity/)'s Iva and modding skills this will be very good addition to the already really cool mod. You are really good at making the labs have unique IVA's. Good luck!

looks like im getting the same problem with the wings and the control surfaces not creating lift, i do not have <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> installed. Is there a remedy for this issue?

Also getting problems with the OMS engines(showing duplicates in same pod) and the mono radial pods, im using <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> 2.7.1     would that be the cause of my problem's? 

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-10T15:31:59Z" title="10/10/2016 03:31  PM" data-short="7 yr">October 10, 2016</time> by mechanicH**
This and Mk2 Expansion will be placed inside my GameData as soon as they're updated for 1.2. Great mods! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

[@mechanicH](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167929-mechanich/): For the wings issue I'm going to need KSP version, mod list, and reproduction steps, because *something* is going on that isn't happening when I've tested the wings.

For the mesh duplication issue, do you have InterstellarFuelSwitch installed? OMS engines and the radial tanks use IFS for mesh switching between part variants. Note that the version of ISF included with M3X is for 1.1.3, and won't work with the 1.2 prerelease.

M3X Update 1.2.1 for KSP 1.2 is now up, grab from [SpaceDock](http://spacedock.info/mod/663/Mk3%20Stockalike%20Expansion) or [GitHub](https://github.com/SuicidalInsanity/Mk3Expansion/releases/tag/1.2.1). Mainly a KSP version compatibility update; changelog:

Spoiler

Version 1.2.1  

================================  

-Update for KSP 1.2  

-Part categories updated to use 1.2 categories  

-Fixes Inline docking port control from here issue  

-New Part: Mk3 Science Lab  

-Model Rework: Mk2 Inverted adapter now has horizontal/vertical variants  

-Coxswain OMS now uses new FX  

-Mk3-2 cockpit now uses new <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> FX  

-Fixed Linear Aerospike bottom node orientation
Look's like you did not add antenna module to mk3 cockpits and drone core.

[@SuicidalInsanity](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/143878-suicidalinsanity/), Thats a awfully big plug for a coffee-maker. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

I am loving this mod. Using the mk3 parts, I appear to have a 30 ton payload <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>, fitting right into my long term plans. It actually may deliver up to 50, but I tried with an imaginary 30 t relatively successful. I haven't learned to land <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>'s well yet. I may post craft file if interested, but it will use b9 procedural and interstellerr fuel switch. More might be involved, but I haven't done 100% inventory.

Possibly worth noting, but the mod (and bundled IFS and <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr>) are in a folder called Gamedata instead of GameData. This may result in frown-upon-able shenanigans for users who extract directly to their KSP install folder without paying attention to the capitalization.
Updated some mods and now the control surfaces don't move. any suggestions

@King Something: That could be an issue, thanks for the heads up

@Ivans: I'm going to need a mod list and your output\_log; is this an issue that affects only M3X control surfaces, or other mod control surfaces as well?
